snippet.title: New York City Bans Trans Fats
snippet.description: ... The New York City Board of Health passed a ban on trans fats in December. This widely used fat has been linked to heart disease . This ban, the first on a food item approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), requires restaurants to eliminate trans fats from all of their foods by July 2008. They must stop using frying oils that contain trans fat by July of 2007. This ban is a controversial step towards better health in a city many associate with great food. Some argue that Mayor Michael Bloomberg is trying to legislate people’s diets. However, trans fats have been found to have an adverse effect on cholesterol levels because they lower your good cholesterol level while raising your bad cholesterol level. Trans fat consumption has been associated with an increased risk of heart disease. In fact, the FDA now requires all food manufacturers to include trans fat on the nutrition facts panel of all foods. Trans fats are used for frying and baking and are found in many com... ...
